title: Do the Bruins have a potential breakout prospect in camp in Dans Locmelis?
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Dans Locmelis impressed during the 2025 IIHF World Championships, scoring four goals and six points in seven games for Latvia.
Locmelis, a 2022 fourth-round pick, is set to attend his first pro camp with the Bruins after a strong season with UMass and Providence Bruins.
Locmelis is noted for his hockey IQ and creativity, with Bruins personnel expecting him to compete for an NHL roster spot in training camp.

title: Rob Gronkowski: Patriots QB Drake Maye looked ‘timid’ against Raiders
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Rob Gronkowski criticized Patriots QB Drake Maye's performance against the Raiders, calling it timid and lacking growth.
Patriots lost 20-13 to the Raiders; Drake Maye threw 150 yards, one touchdown, and one interception.
Questions arose about Maye's workload under Josh McDaniels' offense, but he hasn't noticed major changes in preparation.

title: Braintree man dies weeks after being struck by e-bike in Copley Square
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Minh Dang, 64, of Braintree, died after being struck by an e-bike in Copley Square on August 6.
The incident occurred near Huntington Avenue and Dartmouth Street in front of the Boston Public Library.
The e-bike operator stayed at the scene; no charges have been filed, according to Boston police.

title: Watch out for the ‘wicked high’ king tides this week at Boston Harbor
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Boston Harbor will experience perigean spring tides, commonly known as king tides, throughout the fall.
King tides occur when the moon's orbit is closest to Earth, resulting in tides two to four feet higher.
Events at Long Wharf will be held during these high tides starting September 11, organized by Stone Living Lab.

title: Stefon Diggs says Drake Maye isn’t a ‘softie’ when it comes to criticism
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Stefon Diggs supports Patriots QB Drake Maye, stating he can handle criticism and is not a 'softie.'
Drake Maye completed 30-of-46 passes for 287 yards, one touchdown, and one interception in loss to Raiders.
Maye faced criticism for second-half struggles, with Patriots' offense stalling and losing 20-13 to Las Vegas.

title: Audit: K-12 school department failed to investigate 22 child abuse reports
author: Molly Farrar
bullets: State audit reveals 22 child abuse reports went uninvestigated by the Department of Elementary and Secondary Education.
The audit found communication breakdown between DESE and DCF from February 2020 to mid-2023 affects report processing.
DESE also delayed resolving special education complaints and lacked support for LGBTQ student initiatives, audit notes.

title: ‘Nothing short of horrific’: Mass. politicians react to fatal shooting of Charlie Kirk
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Charlie Kirk, conservative activist, was fatally shot at Utah Valley University during a public debate.
Massachusetts politicians, including Gov. Maura Healey, condemned the killing and called for an end to political violence.
Authorities have not identified a suspect; a person was questioned then released by law enforcement.

title: Patriots injury report: Christian Gonzalez not practicing, along with 2 key vets
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Christian Gonzalez remains absent from Patriots practice due to a hamstring injury, sidelining him since July 28.
Harold Landry and Morgan Moses also missed practice with foot injuries, causing concern for Sunday's game.
Wide receiver Kayshon Boutte was limited in practice with a shoulder injury but played well against the Raiders.

title: Drake Maye talks starting fast, capitalizing in the red zone, and the throws he wished he had back
author: Khari A. Thompson
bullets: Drake Maye acknowledged he rushed some throws during the Patriots' loss to the Raiders, leading to missed opportunities.
The Patriots struggled in the red zone, converting only one of three chances, while the Raiders converted their single opportunity.
Maye emphasized starting faster and improving red zone efficiency as key areas for the team's offensive progress.

title: What Celtics star Jaylen Brown said about potentially playing for hometown team
author: Conor Ryan
bullets: Jaylen Brown hinted at a future interest in playing for the Atlanta Hawks, despite having four years left with the Celtics.
Brown will take on a larger role this season for the Celtics due to Jayson Tatum's injury and roster changes.
The Celtics are reshaping their roster, with Brown seen as a key figure after trading Kristaps Porzingis and Jrue Holiday.
